en: At that time, saith Jehovah, will I be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be my people.
hmr: LALPA chun, “Chu pha chun Israel pahnam po pohai Pa- thien chu nîng ka ta, anni chu ka mihai nîng an tih,” a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, The people that were left of the sword found favor in the wilderness; even Israel, when I went to cause him to rest.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih, “Mipui kâwlhnâma inthawka suok- hai chu thlalêra khan lunginsietna an hmu a; Israelin châwlna a zawng lai chun,

en: Jehovah appeared of old unto me, saying, Yea, I have loved thee with an everlasting love: therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn thee.
hmr: LALPA chu hlataka inthawkin a kuomah a hung inlâr a. Kumkhaw hmangaina chun ka hmangai che a, chuleiin, lunginsietna ngilneina chun ka hîp che a.

en: Again will I build thee, and thou shalt be built, O virgin of Israel: again shalt thou be adorned with thy tabrets, and shalt go forth in the dances of them that make merry.
hmr: Bâwl nâwk ka ti cheh a, bâwlin um i tih, Aw Israel nunghâk inthieng. Khuong têhai leh inthuom nâwk i ta, hlimna siema lâmtuhai lai chun fe suok i tih.

en: Again shalt thou plant vineyards upon the mountains of Samaria; the planters shall plant, and shall enjoy the fruit thereof.
hmr: Samaria tlâng chungahai chun grêp huonhai chu siem nâwk i ta; a phuntuhai chun phun an ta, a ra chu chên an tih.

en: For there shall be a day, that the watchmen upon the hills of Ephraim shall cry, Arise ye, and let us go up to Zion unto Jehovah our God.
hmr: Ephraim muolhaia vêngtuhai chun, ‘Tho unla, LALPA ei Pathien kuomah Ziona chun fêng ei tiu,’ tia an khêkna nihai chu a la hung tlung ding a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: For thus saith Jehovah, Sing with gladness for Jacob, and shout for the chief of the nations: publish ye, praise ye, and say, O Jehovah, save thy people, the remnant of Israel.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a; Jakob ta ding chun lâwmin hla sak unla, hnamhai lua um ta ding chun khêk bawk ro, phuong dar unla, inpâk unla, “Aw LALPA, Israel hla bîkhai, i mihai hi sandam rawh,” ti ro.

en: Behold, I will bring them from the north country, and gather them from the uttermost parts of the earth, and with them the blind and the lame, the woman with child and her that travaileth with child together: a great company shall they return hither.
hmr: Ngai ta u, hmârtieng rama inthawk chun anni chu hung ṭhuoi ka ta, chun, hnuoi hmun hlatakhaia in- thawk chun, anni le mitdel dâm, ke inbai dâm, nuhmei nau pawmlai dâm, nauhase nat tuor lai dâm chu hung ṭhuoi khâwm ka tih; chuong- chun, pâwl ropuitak chu hitieng hin hung kîr an tih.

en: They shall come with weeping; and with supplications will I lead them: I will cause them to walk by rivers of waters, in a straight way wherein they shall not stumble; for I am a father to Israel, and Ephraim is my first-born.
hmr: Ṭap pumin hung an ta, thla- muongtakin anni chu ṭhuoi ka ta, tuihai vadungpuihai sîra chun, lam- pui tlûnah an insui nawna dinga chun anni chu infetir ka ta, Israel pa chu ka na, Ephraim chu ka nau lutîrtak a ni sih a.

en: Hear the word of Jehovah, O ye nations, and declare it in the isles afar off; and say, He that scattered Israel will gather him, and keep him, as a shepherd doth his flock.
hmr: Aw nangni hnamhai, LALPA thu chu ngai unla, thlierkâr hlataka- hai chun phuong ro; chun, “Israel sukdartu ngei chun, ama chu kei khâwm nâwk a ta, berâmpuin a berâm ruol a kawl ang chun ama chu kawl a tih,” tiin hril ro.

en: For Jehovah hath ransomed Jacob, and redeemed him from the hand of him that was stronger than he.
hmr: LALPA chun Jakob chu ama nêka hrât lem kuta inthawk chun ân tlansuokin a sansuok ta sih a.

en: And they shall come and sing in the height of Zion, and shall flow unto the goodness of Jehovah, to the grain, and to the new wine, and to the oil, and to the young of the flock and of the herd: and their soul shall be as a watered garden; and they shall not sorrow any more at all.
hmr: Chun, hung an ta, Zion tlâng insângna laiahai chun hla hung sak an ta; LALPA ṭhatnaa chun bua leh, uoina leh, hrieka leh, berâm le bâwng ruol têhaiah lâwm an tih; an thla chu tuihnâwngtak huon ang nîng a ta, lungngai nâwk ta hrim hrim naw ni hai.

en: Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance, and the young men and the old together; for I will turn their mourning into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow.
hmr: Chun, nunghâk inthienghai chu, tlangvâlhai le, upahai le chun lâmnaa chun hlim an ta; an lusûnna chu hlimnaah kân changtir ding a ni sih a; chun, anni chu thlamuon ka ta, an lungngainaa inthawk chun suk- hlim tâng ka tih.

en: And I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness, and my people shall be satisfied with my goodness, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Thiempuhai thlarau chu thâuin sukkhawp ka ta, ka mihai chu ka ṭhatnain tlai an tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: A voice is heard in Ramah, lamentation, and bitter weeping, Rachel weeping for her children; she refuseth to be comforted for her children, because they are not.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Rama khuoah khêkri an hriet a, ṭap dâm, mithi ngaia khêk rawng rawng dâm, Rakil chun a nauhai a ṭah a, an um ta naw leiin thlamuon thei a ni nawh.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: Refrain thy voice from weeping, and thine eyes from tears; for thy work shall be rewarded, saith Jehovah; and they shall come again from the land of the enemy.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: I râwl chu ṭapnaa inthawk le, i mithai chu mitthlihaia inthawkin insûm rawh; i sinthaw chu lâwmman pêk a ni ding a ni sih a, LALPA chun a tih; chun, anni chu hmêlma rama in- thawk chun hung kîr nâwk an tih.

en: And there is hope for thy latter end, saith Jehovah; and thy children shall come again to their own border.
hmr: I hihnung tâwpna tienga ding chun beiseina a um a nih, LALPA chun a tih: i thlahai chu an ramri sûnga ngei chun hung nâwk an tih.

en: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself thus, Thou hast chastised me, and I was chastised, as a calf unaccustomed to the yoke: turn thou me, and I shall be turned; for thou art Jehovah my God.
hmr: Ephraim chu hieng ang lusûn hin ka hriet ngei a nih: “Bâwngtê rîngkawl la bât ṭhang lo angin nangin i mi thununa, thununin ka um a; nangin mîn hertir la, chuongchun, inher ka tih: nang chu LALPA ka Pathien i ni sih a,” tiin.

en: Surely after that I was turned, I repented; and after that I was instructed, I smote upon my thigh: I was ashamed, yea, even confounded, because I did bear the reproach of my youth.
hmr: Matheiloin, chu hnunga chun kân let a, kei khawm ka lamlêt tah a; chun, chu hnunga chun inchûktirin ka uma, ka êlpui chu ka ben a; kân zak a, anih, ka tleirâwl lai hmingsietna chu ka phur leiin, ka hamhai nghe nghe a.

en: Is Ephraim my dear son? is he a darling child? for as often as I speak against him, I do earnestly remember him still: therefore my heart yearneth for him; I will surely have mercy upon him, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Ephraim hi ka naupa dittak am a nih? Ama hi naupang tiawi am a nih? Ama ka thunun pha, ama chu ka hriet zing tlat el hi? Chuleiin, ka lungril chun ama ka lainat a; matheiloin, ama chunga chun zâ- ngaina nei ngei ka tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Set thee up waymarks, make thee guide-posts; set thy heart toward the highway, even the way by which thou wentest: turn again, O virgin of Israel, turn again to these thy cities.
hmr: Lampui inchiknahai siem la, zui ding hmawlphunhai siem rawh, tlânglam tiengah, i fena lampui chu ngaituo la, kîr nâwk rawh. Aw nu- nghâk inthieng Israel, hieng i khaw- puihai tienga hin kîr nâwk rawh.

en: How long wilt thou go hither and thither, O thou backsliding daughter? for Jehovah hath created a new thing in the earth: A woman shall encompass a man.
hmr: Aw nang naunu hnungtawl, ieng chen am hitieng sawtieng i fe lawn ding a na? Hnuoia chun LALPA chun thil thar a siemsuok a, “Nuhmeiin pasal a hum ta lem,” ti hi.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Yet again shall they use this speech in the land of Judah and in the cities thereof, when I shall bring again their captivity: Jehovah bless thee, O habitation of righteousness, O mountain of holiness.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: An sal intângna ka hung lâk kîr nâwk pha chun Juda rama le chutaka khawpuihaia chun hi ṭawngbau hi la hmang nâwk an tih: “Aw indikna chêngna, LALPA chun mal sâwm raw se che,” ti dâm le, “Aw inthiengna tlâng,” ti dâm hi.

en: And Judah and all the cities thereof shall dwell therein together, the husbandmen, and they that go about with flocks.
hmr: Chun, Juda le chutaka khaw- puihai po po chu um hmunkhat tâng an ta; loneituhai le, berâm ruol le invâk vêlhai khawm chu.

en: For I have satiated the weary soul, and every sorrowful soul have I replenished.
hmr: Mi chauhai chu ka suktlai a, mi lungngai tinhai khawm chu ka sukhar bawk a.

en: Upon this I awaked, and beheld; and my sleep was sweet unto me.
hmr: Hi lei hin ka tho a, ka en a, ka imu chu inhnik ka ti êm êm a.

en: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of beast.
hmr: Ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung, LALPA chun a tih: Juda sûng- kuo le Israel sûngkuo chu ramsa chi le mihriem chiin tûng ka ta.

en: And it shall come to pass that, like as I have watched over them to pluck up and to break down and to overthrow and to destroy and to afflict, so will I watch over them to build and to plant, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, anni chu hmalthla ding le, sukchim ding le, peithla ding le, sukse ding le, sukrinum dinga ka enkai zing ang khan, chuong ang bawk chun, anni chu bâwl ding le phun dingin enkai zing ka tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: In those days they shall say no more, The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are set on edge.
hmr: Chuong niahai chun, “Thlatu- hai chu grêp thûr an fâk leiin, an thlahai hahai chu a ṭim,” ti ta ngai naw ni hai.

en: But every one shall die for his own iniquity: every man that eateth the sour grapes, his teeth shall be set on edge.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi tin chu mâni suolnaa ngei chun thîng a ta, mi tin grêp thûr fatu chu, ama hahai ngei chu ṭim a tih.

en: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah:
hmr: Ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung, LALPA chun a tih, Juda sûng- kuo le Israel sûngkuo le chun thuthlung thar siem ka ta;

en: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt; which my covenant they brake, although I was a husband unto them, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawka hung ṭhuoi suok dinga kuta anni ka chel nia an thlatuhai kuoma thuthlung ka siem ang dungzui kha ni loin, an ta dingin pasal ka ni dea chu, chu ka thuthlung chu an bawsiet a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith Jehovah: I will put my law in their inward parts, and in their heart will I write it; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
hmr: Amiruokchu, chuong nihai hnunga Israel sûngkuo le thuthlung ka siem ding chu hi hi nîng a tih, LALPA chun a tih: an sûngrilahai chun ka dân chu sieng ka ta, an lungrilahai chun ziek bawk ka tih; chun, an Pathien nîng ka ta, anni chu ka mihai nîng an tih,

en: And they shall teach no more every man his neighbor, and every man his brother, saying, Know Jehovah; for they shall all know me, from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith Jehovah: for I will forgive their iniquity, and their sin will I remember no more.
hmr: chun, mi tinin mâni tuol- bâwmhai chu inchûktir ta naw ni hai a, mâni unauhai seng leh; “LALPA chu hre ro,” tiin inchûktir ta naw ni hai, anni a chîn taka inthawka a lien tak chenin kei an mi hriet vawng ta ding a nih, LALPA chun a tih: an bawsietnahai chu ngaidam ka ta, an suolna khawm hre zing ta naw ning.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, who giveth the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, who stirreth up the sea, so that the waves thereof roar; Jehovah of hosts is his name:
hmr: Sûna nisa chu var dinga pea, zâna arasihai le thla var dinga ruotna petu, tuisuoriet chu chawkthoa, tuifâwnhai inrûmtirtu LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: ama chu sipaihai LALPA chu a hming a na;

en: If these ordinances depart from before me, saith Jehovah, then the seed of Israel also shall cease from being a nation before me for ever.
hmr: Hieng thil ruothai hi ka hmaa inthawka an lo fe hmang chun, Israel khawm chu kumkhuoa dingin ka hmaa chun hnam an ni chu bo ve bawk a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, then will I also cast off all the seed of Israel for all that they have done, saith Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Chunga vân khi inkhi thei a na, hnuoia leihnuoi lungphûm chu zawng suok thei a ni chun, thil an lo thaw tahai po po lei khan Israel chi chu pei hmang vêng ka tih: LALPA chun a tih.

en: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that the city shall be built to Jehovah from the tower of Hananel unto the gate of the corner.
hmr: Ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung, LALPA chun a tih: Hananel in insânga inthawka a kia dai kawtkhâr chenin, LALPA ta dingin khawpui chu bâwl nîng a tih.

en: And the measuring line shall go out further straight onward unto the hill Gareb, and shall turn about unto Goah.
hmr: Chun, ân khina hmawl chu Gareb tlâng chenin fe tluon suok a ta, Goaa chun va kâwi a tih.

en: And the whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields unto the brook Kidron, unto the corner of the horse gate toward the east, shall be holy unto Jehovah; it shall not be plucked up, nor thrown down any more for ever.
hmr: Chun, mithi ruong phairuom pumpui le, vut phairuom le Kidron vadungtê chen, saktienga sakawr dai kawtkhâr chen ram po po kha, LALPA chanpuol nîng a tih, sukdar ni naw nih a, kumkhuoin pei thlâk khawm ni bawk naw nih.
